results.title: Principles of ultrasonics
results.creator_credit: Jack Chambers and Data Film Productions
results.brief_description: Indicates the relation and range of sonic and ultrasonic waves. Also shows how ultrasonic waves are detected and the various types of wave generator used to propagate them; their properties and the uses to which they can be put.
results.description: Indicates the relation and range of sonic and ultrasonic waves. Also shows how ultrasonic waves are detected and the various types of wave generator used to propagate them; their properties and the uses to which they can be put.

results.title: Principles of the transistor
results.brief_description: Explains by means of diagrams and photography the principles and manufacture of transistors.

results.title: Principles of the optical maser
results.creator_credit: Ed Atwood, Sol Dworkin and Bell Telephone Laboratories
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the applications of basic physical principles in the oscillation of an optical maser. Explains that it is a generator of electromagnetic energy in the optical range of frequencies and is similar to standard radio and microwave oscillators. Demonstrates the use of the principal types of gas and solid state optical masers in the laboratory.

results.title: Principles of stock control
results.brief_description: A study of a number of different methods of stock control. A small company which has to invest heavily in machinery is compared with one which has to invest in comparatively large stocks of material - the points made are then applied to larger companies. Shows application of stock control to volatile and inflammable liquids, paperback books, and the raw materials of food canning industry.

results.title: Principles of routine composition
results.creator_credit: Mary Ann Reeves and Coaching Association of Canada
results.brief_description: Step by step instruction on how to compose a routine for synchronised swimming. Counting out music, land drills, coaching techniques, putting ideas together and practical methods are all considered.

results.title: Principles of respiratory mechanics. Part II
results.brief_description: Uses both normal subjects and patients with asthma, pulmonary fibrosis, and emphysema, and respiratory muscle paralysis to illustrate alterations in the mechanics of breathing produced by disease. Using modes and animated drawings, illustrates pulmonary subdivision, explains the work of breathing, and points out the value of mechanical measurements.

results.title: Principles of refining
results.brief_description: This tape contains two programs explaining how crude oil is turned into usable products by the refining process. ‘Physical separation’: tells the story of physical separation, the distillation process used throughout the refinery to separate molecules. The process is shown and explained in some detail, both in live action and animation. ‘Chemical conversion’: physical separation provides only a certain amount of product. Further reactions like catalytic cracking and reforming continue the process. This portion of the tape includes footage of the Shell Hycon plant in the Netherlands.

results.title: Principles of radio. Part 3. The Vacuum tube
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains by animated drawings, the operation of a radio vacuum tube in terms of its filament, plate, and grid circuits. Illustrates the three functions of the vacuum tube in radio: how it serves as an amplifier to operate the loud-speaker, as a rectifier in detection, and as an oscillator to generate the carrier wave.
results.title_for_label: Principles of radio. Part 3. The Vacuum tube
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Principles of radio. Part 2. Receiving radio messages
results.brief_description: The general principles of the radio receiver are explained, and the following points treated in detail: the problem of tuning; the capacity of a variable condenser; the inductance of a coil; resonance; detection, and how a crystal is used as a detector; the operation of an earphone; the production of audible sound waves.

results.title: Principles of radio. Part 1. Sending radio messages
results.brief_description: Detailed treatment is given to the following: operation of the microphone, transformer and modulator; nature of a sound wave; direct current; alternating current; voice current; carrier wave; and amplification.
